alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 10:03PM CDT until May 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR EASTERN LIVINGSTON...FORD AND IROQUOIS COUNTIES... At 1003 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from St. Anne to 6 miles west of Watseka to 6 miles southwest of Paxton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Watseka and Martinton around 1010 PM CDT. Sheldon around 1025 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Melvin, Papineau, Campus, Thawville, Donovan, Loda, Claytonville, Crescent City, Sibley and Roberts. Including the following interstate... I-57 between mile markers 258 and 301. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
